result.execSummary:
The defendant Edwin A Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is ordered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, wtih Attorney Poss.  Victim notification not needed, victim never responded.  Parties have the revocation packet.  State recommended:  Count 2, 90 days.  Count 4, 4 months jail.  Concurrent.  Credit for 102 days.  Attorney Poss agrees with the State's recommendation.  

Court ordered:  90 days jail on count 2.  4 months jail on Count 4.  Concurrent.  Credit for 102 days.  Time served.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Edwin A Johnson
Current: 502 E. Center St., Blair, WI 54616-9338 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2015)
Prior: 405 S. Hayden St., Lot 21, Merrillan, WI 54754 United States

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Defendant plead no contest to Counts 2 and 4.  Court dismissed and read in counts 1 and 3 for sentencing purposes.   Court advised the defendant of the penalties of the charges he plead to.  He understood.   Elements reviewed by the court with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defendant understood.   Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the charges plead to.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Court found the defendant guilty of count 2 and amended count 4. Joint recommendation for 18 mo. probation concurrent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC. Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 18 months probation.  Each count concurrent and concurrent with the probation now serving.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-21-2015 10:30 am
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Set for plea/sentencing on 9/21/15 at 10:30 am.
of 8/24/15 STC notice.  RTS, in dispute, UTF
Status conference at 08-24-2015 03:45 pm
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Poss gave DA new information.  STC 8/24/15 at 3:45 pm.

Bond amended with:  No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with:A. H.    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limit for the preliminary hearing.  Defendant stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived the time limit for having the preliminary hearing heard.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  No counsel present.  Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties.  Defendant stated that he did not have counsel yet.  Court advised defendant of his options. AIA set for 6/1/15 at 9:30 am.  Bond set.
